content.rendered:
Join our Team

Our caregivers are special people with just the right touch. If you’re a caring, compassionate individual we would love to have you join our team. We provide training, competitive wages and flexible scheduling. Available positions are listed below. Please click to open and read the job description. Submit your cover letter and resume by email or US Postal Service. For an overview of the services we provide visit our companion care page. No phone calls please.

Caregiver Aide

Responsibilities to provide direct patient care to our clients. Preform duties for client to include dressing assistance, ambulating assistance, bathing, assisting client to toilet. Light housekeeping to include bathroom, kitchen cleaning after meals, meal preparation, vacuuming, and laundry as needed and per contract. Transportation to doctor and dentist appointments, and errands to be performed such as grocery shopping, and drug store.

Required Qualifications
  • High School Diploma, GED, or equivalevt
  • Certified Nurse Aide or Certified Medical Assistant or a junior status in an accredited BSN program or 2nd year in ADN program
  • One year minimum of recent experience in an unlicensed assistive role or hospital setting or two years experience in nursing home
  • Demonstrates Good Attendance records
  • Demonstrates interpersonal and problem solving skills
  • Demonstrates initiative and a commitment to provide quality patient care
  • Demonstrates ability to work collaboratively and independently and function at a level of team work
  • Ability to solve problems
  • Positive conflict resolution skills
  • Ability to be flexible and adapt to stressful situations
  • Reliable Vehicle
  • Valid Driver’s License
  • Car Registration and Insurance
Desired Qualifications
  • Six months direct patient care
  • Graduate of an approved and accredited CNA program
Work Schedule
  • Hours per week 36 or 40
  • 8 hour shifts or 12 hour shift
Background Screening

Home Comfort Care conducts a thorough background check and drug screening that are in compliance with the Fair Credit Report Act

Professional Home Maintenance Staff

Maintenance staff inspect equipment to determine maintenance needs by performing comprehensive test on thermostats, plumbing, heating, cooling, and electrical equipment, lubricate hinges , garage door rollers, charge batteries smoke / co detectors and perform repairs.

Responsibilities
  • Replace or adjust door knobs, hinges, door stops, and toilet seats
  • Replace electric cords, lights,and door bells
  • Clean gutters
  • Unplug commodes, sink drains, sewer lines, and water lines
  • Replace or repair blinds
  • Clean and/or change furnace filters
  • Remove snow from walkways and driveway
Required Qualifications:
  • Must have high school diploma or equivalent
  • Candidates must be able to move and position heavy objects
  • Reliable Vehicle
  • Valid Driver’s License
  • Car Registration and Insurance
Desired Qualifications:
  • Prior experience
  • In a maintenance field
  • Minor Electrical repair
  • Minor Plumbing repair
  • Minor carpentry repair
  • Experience with HVAC
  • Good record keeping skills
Work Schedule
  • 40 hours/week
MAIL YOUR RESUME

Send your cover letter and resume to:
Home Comfort Care
Attn: Cheryl Linderman
143 CadyCentre, #208
Northville, MI 48167

EMAIL YOUR RESUME
